name: Central Control Kate
description:
Know stuff, control stuff!

Keep centrals de-iced or cheap to break with Parasite/Atman/Corroder as necessary.

Keyhole/Indexing for smart R&D check-ins. Record Reconstructor for slowing the Corp's pace, giving back trashed ice at Atman's installed strength, dealing with Shock dumped in Archives.

Woman in the Red Dress for HQ knowledge and milling pace (it goes faster than you think if you get Keyhole/WitRD out early), Sneakdoor Beta for surprise tactics.

Oh, and passive/draw economy!

name: Weyland - It smells like Meat V4
VoicePAD Exile
description: My first try at an exile deck. I use retrieval runs to install the expensive icebreakers for cheap. Public sympathy and draw are used to shrug off damage. I feel like I need a few more programs but I'm not sure what to cut and what to put in.

name: Making it Reina
description:
Full explanation on the BGG Thread: http://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1106028/deck-making-it-reina

Summary: pile up money, running only sparingly. don't let them rez ice on R&D, vamp them, then spam keyhole until you win.

name: Through the Keyhole 1.5
description: Added knights and 2 pawns to handle bigger ICE. I would still like to get 2-3 dirty laundry to shore up the economy but I'll play test this for now.

name: Quit Screwin' Around v1.0
Insufficient funds
description: The purpose of this deck is to make it prohibitively expensive for the runner to do anything to you. The target for rototurret is their code gate breaker to make rsvp a fantastic end the run ice for protecting a remote. This deck is 7/0 so far, i always have the money to advance and the runner is constantly trying to catch up. If they do i throw a breaking news down with a red herring to try to clean them out then put down a bigger agenda with a new red herring or a new piece of ice.

name: Insufficient funds (actual)
description: The purpose of this deck is to make it prohibitively expensive for the runner to do anything to you. The target for rototurret is their code gate breaker to make rsvp a fantastic end the run ice for protecting a remote. This deck is 7/0 so far, i always have the money to advance and the runner is constantly trying to catch up. If they do i throw a breaking news down with a red herring to try to clean them out then put down a bigger agenda with a new red herring or a new piece of ice.

name: Free money
description: Cheap runs and trashing stuff for less.

name: Weyland meat market
description: Based on a deck by zerohour, threaten meat damage all the time, threaten a 5/3 and then counter strike. Score if they don't run, use ghost branch to put tags on, put down snares and dedicated teams.

name: She Ain't Nothin But A Golddigger
Gabe jacks in directly
description: Run really cheap and take advantage of criminal events to keep the corp down

name: Destrucción del parásito 1.6
description: My version of the Ice Destruction deck that was running around at Worlds. The original list had no breakers at all, and while it was good, it would get stopped by iced-up remotes and by big ice that could endure a Parasite with periodic purges (which then wiped out the Datasuckers.)

name: The Great Keyholio
description: Made mostly for wrecking central servers in general and keyholing your R&D. Otherwise is a fairly straightforward Noise Parasite/Datasucker virus spam deck, using Sahasrara and Cyberfeeder for installation economy, Crypsis to get past trouble spots, and Mimic to counter Swordsman.

name: Analyze and Destroy (looking for feedback)
description: This deck is ice destruction and program installation based on free credits from ice analyser. Sacrificial contruct to protect wurm and data sucker from power shut down. Lots of recursion. Crypsis for emergencies

name: NBN NA Rush
NBN Baggin'
RSVP regrets only. 1.5
description: Updated with true colors and some minor changes.

name: Mac's pretty red dress
A Whiz at Destruction
description:
Whizzard - DLR deck featuring keyhole

Like most tag-me DLR decks the hardest part is just keeping your economy going, this is helped by whiz's ability to trash assets, MO, and prepaid-voicepads + gambles and dirty laundries. In addition, Activist Support is there to potentially put bad-pub on the corp making runs cheaper and more money that can be vamped.

Since card-draw can be tough, Special Orders are in to get any breakers out asap.

Record Reconstructor can be removed but since I would potentially be hitting archives often after keyhole, I wouldn't want to get hit with Shock! every time :)

Some possible ideas: adding in Scherazades or Spinal Modems instead of the mem chips

name: Monolith Theory v2
description:
My personal adaptation of the 'Big Girls Play with Monoliths' deck, I've switched around to fit my playstyle. You can read more about some of the basics and inspiration here: http://netrunnerdb.com/en/decklist/808/big-girls-play-with-monoliths

So the big question is, what does monolith do that other consoles don't and is it worth the credits? I would say most definitely yes, but you certainly need to have a deck that can bring it out efficiently. Two major things monolith does: it can surprise the corp by bringing out programs from your hand mid-run (via Personal Workshop, explained more below), it gives you enough program memory to have almost every situation covered, and lastly it let's you choose what goes if you're hit by damage while you're running. If you have a hand full of programs (and you will). You're not invincible, you're still discarding cards but this way you don't leave it up to chance and you don't have to worry about permanent brain damage.

This version uses Personal Workshop to get the Monolith out, along with other hardware. Why Personal Workshop? Two reasons: one is bad publicity is being generated often by corps these days (three bad pub means 12c off PW for a turn, even if you're slamming into a wall), and second is you often need to let is simmer on PW to get all the needed programs in your hand. This let's you bring monolith off mid run and surprise the hell out of the corp when after rezzing that archer you monolith out a sharpshooter and crescentus.

I didn't publish version one, but this version introduces capstones to help with the card draw. Any comments or suggestions are welcome!

name: D1K
description:
I played the "Jamesteki" build a ways back but have been looking forward to Shock too much to not come back to the concept.

Obviously the idea with this deck is to score by putting the runner in a position where running at all carries unacceptable risks. I added Grims because in the current meta, now that Shock is out, I expect Net Shields to be all over the place. Thankfully, Veteran's Program adds to the stable of tricks that can be used to shed Bad Publicity. And with the removal of Profiteering, this deck no longer gives up BP like it did originally.

Finally, perhaps I can achieve my dream of putting 6 points of Damage into archives and only giving up 4-5 AP FTW.

name: Quit Screwin' Around v1.1
Key Virii v0.1
description: First pass Noise Virus, with making room for Keyhole. Still need to cut it down to 45.

name: Key Virii v0.2
description: First pass Noise Virus, with making room for Keyhole. Still need to cut it down to 45.

name: Somebody's Watching Me
Skeletal Running 2014
description: This is an update to the deck I played for the Toronto segments of the Plugged-In Tour, placing 3rd and 1st respectively.

name: Jinteki Beta Test
description: Quick deck I put together. Debating on adding in 3 Veterans Programs and dropping 2 Private Security Force. Also adding a 3rd Tsurugi. Going to run this at a local tournament. Any thoughts are welcome.
